Bought some gifts and left super happy! This restaurant works as a team. They help each other and things are not just on one server! A must go to place when you are close to Las Vegas!!!!  Their sweet tea is the bomb! I order mine half sweet half unsweetened! Yummm

YxR79L6R8w_sBkR-J4AKpQ.text: Do not recommend this place. I absolutely love Cracker Barrel and have eaten and enjoyed it in about 4 different states. Ordered a to-go order and they said it would take 10-15 mins. It was a simple one meal order of the grandpas breakfast meal. After 30 minutes I asked the status of my order and they said that they were bagging it... they finally came out after 5 more mins. To top it off the food was cold.y worst Cracker Barrel experience out of around 20. Wish a manager would contact me, the experience and customer service was that bad.

J0oOMrUoOGgBI-d2vl61rQ.text: I finally made it to this location after months of being open. We came on a Tuesday evening so it was not as busy and we waited 10min at most. The location has the same setup as all the other locations around the south with the rocking chairs, retail shop and the table seating and menu. I ordered country fried chicken with baked beans and a hash brown casserole. Everything was up to par with the other Cracker Barrel's I have been to and I will gladly come back again as long as the waits aren't ridiculous.

MIa8wihvfxYEkTJLKrl2zA.text: We went on their third day open. The gift store is full of goodies. The staff is very friendly. They gave a wait time of an hour, but it was more like 24 minutes. We hardly noticed, because we were in the rocking chairs talking and laughing.  I had the rainbow trout. It was very good and the portion sizes, are big. You definitely get your money's worth. Nice family style, relaxed, setting.

1mngohO5xAhfa7JDXm6LEw.text: This particular cracker barrel is complete shit with incompetent staff. We waited 35 minutes for a table for 10. We were then sepearated across the room into a party of 4 and a party of 6. When we asked to wait for a table for 10 they told us the wait would be 20 additional minutes. They also won't take reservations. Fuck you Cracker Barrel

_jw-RVkhshTeH23I4cgCAg.text: First time here.. awesome service, no wait and the food was good. Nothing crazy but it was good. And the store was super cute!!

elkkUeyeheJ7GwiKScO-nQ.text: I was sooooo EXCITED that Cracker Barrel had made its way to the valley. Since I grew up, this has been one of my all time favorite places to eat.   Over the years, I've ONLY eaten breakfast here regardless of the time of day. Pecan pancakes, eggs, bacon, hash brown casserole....YUMMY!!!  I knew that by this being a new location, the wait would be long. Hopefully it slows down over time.

P9R5NTqeaclTEiDe-7lvww.text: I couldn't find anything wrong with this place. It was newly opened but everything went so smooth. The place is super crowded when we left, others even waiting outside to be seated. We came early, there's (4) of us and we were seated within 15 minutes. Very friendly staffs, fast service, food was amazing... Specially the pancakes and syrup! The manager came out and ask how our day was and how's the food. We will definitely come back! The only thing is it's TOO FAR from me hahaha .. I wish we had this on Northwest side of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband ordered the ham!

qwOLL6QlooSoRqPp75zvaw.text: The food here sucks.  I will never come here again.  Food tastes like it was frozen and defrosted and they just microwaved everything.  The worst part was the turkey sausage I ordered was raw.  I literally took a bite and got a glob of raw ground turkey.  I ordered the biscuits and gravy and grits with turkey and everything was bland.  I'm sorry I waited 40 mins for cheap diner service and crappy food.

WgABIV8BAas2zIQ_yizm9g.text: my husband & i love cracker barrel ... but ... this location is far from freshness as compared to many others. his order for scrambled eggs looked and acted like a precooked boxed from a cafeteria, though the waitress claimed they're made to order. a "new" plate of eggs looked the same except that it was of larger portion. his sausage patty tasted like it was under the food heater a little to long then got cold as he couldn't get over the texture and grease. my biscuit was hot on the outside but luke warm & dry on the inside. again, possibly under a food warmer too long. needless to say, we couldn't even finish our meals and asked for the check, seeing that the waitress tried to avoid us after questioning the eggs.  we will not return to this particular restaurant.

ckT27LKfasn1QnyKFvr17g.text: I listened to my sister and her friend talk about this place from Los Angeles all the way to Las Vegas. I had never heard about it until then. The best experience I have had in along time. From walking through the store, the associates are welcoming you with smiles.  Once I got to the host another warming smile.  The atmosphere  was  casual everyone is smiling saying hello every time they pass a table.  The team worked together so you never felt you had to wait for one waitress. All this I haven't even talk about the food. Yes mouth watering !!!! The biscuits just melt in your mouth with there apple butter. I can't wait to return.

yIyJYmuLPVKUQHJywHirJw.text: I came to this place earlier today and I do have to say that the gift shop right next to it is so lovely they wall decorations and the people are so nice. The breakfast itself was ok I'd recommend the fried steak and gravy because that was honestly the best along with the hash-brown casserole. I wasn't the most delighted with the eggs though they were a bit undercooked while the bacon was over cooked. I don't really recommend the Fresh starter breakfast because the muffin didn't really taste like wow! It was more of a meh type muffin. In conclusion everyone is so nice and I would really recommend the fried steak and gravy.

qwB8oId1H23t5YNyLLChHQ.text: I really did not like this location. If you have been to other Cracker Barrels, whomever designed the inside of this restaurant really screwed up. It's really large and open with seemingly one million bright lights. It's loud and obnoxious. You feel like you're in some type of mess hall. As compared to food I've had at Cracker Barrels in the south or in St. George, Utah, this one really did not satisfy. I would rather make a special trip to St. George than drive 10 minutes to go here.  As mentioned with other reviews, the wait times are extraordinarily long. I've only eaten there once but I've stopped by three additional times. Each of those three times, the lines have been so ridiculously long and the wait time so ridiculously long that we have chosen to go elsewhere.

U8dmqUb6yGd7GEHP9ocuKw.text: Service was good, but not a fan of the menu, and the food was blah. Eggs were undercooked and biscuits and gravy were flavorless. Sausage was oddly smoky and colorful, and hash browns were salty. Ambience was neat with fire going, but will not be back.

FI9erEh7b1_J8dRkFE0O4w.text: Arrived around 9 am for breakfast on a Tuesday morning. Moderately busy. About 1/3 tables open. Waited in line with about 4-5 other parties for several minutes for 1 person, who was also working the register to start seating people. Once seated, sat for several minutes without anyone greeting us or offering drinks. Several wait staff passed by our table and none would make eye contact with me. After over 5 minutes sitting there and wait staff passing our table at least ten times, we left. As we left I told the host that we couldn't get any service and his reply was "No one waited on you?  Sorry guys".

_fvcZtSoEJ5QL70TvppHtQ.text: So happy they are here in Vegas. Great food, excellent service, and the atmosphere is so fun. Had to stop in the general store, too.

UBO8WyG_7OAuZiXgmGqETg.text: Great home style food. Lots of side options. The sweet tea is a must have. They have fried okra which is delicious. Our waitress was cheerful and very attentive.  The manager greeted us at our table. Great staff. The store has wonderful items to choose from and the pricing is very reasonable

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked fish with green beans and fried okra.
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried chicken, baked apples, sweet potato. Homestyle chicken with Mac n cheese and green beans.

7HhCvYywTLlIxRaPJcm2Dg.text: I LOVE Cracker Barrel. Hubby & I spent the weekend in Vegas and as soon as we saw the sign from the 15, we knew we'd have to stop on our way back home. Got there around 11am on a Sunday, the hour wait was a given and didn't phase us. Took a short walk over to Bass Pro Shops to pass the time. Got a text notification that our table was ready, about an hour and 10 mins later.   Favorites - the melt in your mouth pancakes, cheesy hash brown casserole, and biscuits & gravy.   Service was excellent. Shout out to the hostesses for their patience after dealing with hangry people trying to break down the door all day!  Management, your girls are doing great work!

A_5QuaduNY4v5DQZFs3qeA.text: Starting off we had terrible service. There were several groups of people that sat around us after we sat down they got there order in and food before us. Said ok cool I can be patient, I sorta lost my patience when my water remained empty no joke (20min) before I had to ask another waiter for a refill. Food comes and what do you know, not even hot it was barley warm like it was sitting, kids didn't get ketchup or mayo with there burgers, wife's sausage tasted weird, and no biscuits but everyone else got some.. I normally never leave a crap tip or complain seem that I am in the food and beverage industry but this crap here was ridiculous. Won't be taking my wife and kids here ever again. Bad choice to bring her on her 30th birthday hoping for a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crappy bill for crappy food/service

xis08P0z2ZDEfWfmXW_QqA.text: People who like this food must enjoy hospital food or something. I've now been to this establishment twice on two separate visits to Las Vegas (breakfast and dinner). I have to say I don't understand the hype and I don't know how this place is open.. The ambiance is cool and most of the servers are nice. However the food is mediocre and needs to be seasoned with something other than air. It gets the job done of satisfying hunger but leaves you feeling like you're missing something for sure. I give it two stars for environment, effort, and staff.

OYdnFHUA6J_klsyUGmh-1Q.text: I was pleasantly surprised to find this Cracker Barrel here in Las Vegas, Nv.  It just by chance as I am not from Las Vegas and was here on business! Cracker Barrel was to open a few restaurants in California but have t yet! "Too sad"! But as normal for every time I have had the opportunity to eat at this restaurant I jump in with both feet! The only reason for no fifth star is the biscuits and corn bread was really dry for some reason?

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken dumpling dinner very good!

xSS3ugOpdZ8q7v0kaM2HBw.text: This place was recommended to me by someone I know has similar taste in food and once again it was a success.  I arrived with a party of 4 and our wait time was 25 minutes but luckily we only had to wait 15 of those minutes.  It was of course hotter than the devils armpit outside but the misters made the wait very manageable.  Plus there are cool rocking chairs for guest to sit while they wait and potentially purchase.  I definitely felt like I was sitting on the front porch at my neighbors house, it was very comfortable.  Anyway, once seated we were greeted promptly by our server Jacque ( I hope I spelled that right).  Jacque made our experience very pleasant. My girlfriend and her parents were grateful for the flexibility when it came to switching out items on the combinations they chose to better suit their desires. The food was awesome.  I tried momma's pancake breakfast with a side order of hash brown casserole.  The pancakes were cooked perfect with that delicious crisp around the edges. I love that the pure natural syrup comes in a small glass bottle, although one bottle is not enough for the three pancakes you get with that meal I was still very satisfied. You get a choice between sausage and bacon, I chose the sausage and thought it was fine but my party thought it was to salty.  The hash brown casserole was a nice addition to the meal for some extra flavor and texture.  I made sure to purchase a box of the pancake mix for my cousin Ola (the person who recommended this place) for telling me about this place.  Thank you Jacque for the wonderful service and thank you cracker barrel for the great food

sRa3cAXjNy9IGUtSVITCmQ.text: Food never disappoints but this new location really needs to improve in the service. Our waiter forgot a lot of items so we had to remind her of them. She would forget one item after another.  I love this restaurant. Will come back for the food. Will try the other store too to compare

fwk0ciwaIcU6Te26-IpOkw.text: I love this place! The last time we ate here was while in Virginia.  I'm happy to see them moving to the west coast. Services was excellent! I suggest registering online if you're going on a weekend. We did it about 20 min before arrival and once there we were seated and ordering drinks within 10. Brit was great! She was quick, helpful and awesome. Rather than having us order separate items as we were doing she told us of a meal we could order that had everything we wanted. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a hearty breakfast. Very family friendly as well.

L_5vv9jQUCIehU6_0wRF_g.text: I love Cracker Barrel, but I was skeptical about trying the Vegas location after only having it in the South. Well it was just as great! We came for an early dinner with the kids. Our waitress was so patient, helpful & sweet! The food was as delicious as ever, and of course we had a great time shopping afterwards in the gift shop! I'll definitely be back!

nHTxnaJr7-5Qz6pvnGXjIw.text: Why in the world did they make this location a "West Coast model"? It's so crowded! Did they not think people would come here? It's not enjoyable at all.  I've been eating at Cracker Barrel for 10 years all over the South. Great food, roomy and pleasant atmosphere. But this location is a hot, noisy mess.  Food was ok, not great. I felt like I was sitting at one gigantic community table. So we are back driving to Kingman. I'd rather drive than wait for 1.5 hours to eat locally for sub par food.

SDy88-ptiMWkzurF5m8pSw.text: I feel like the food and service is lacking bc it's always packed.   Always go to the Utah one and food is always good and delicious. Service is always great.   Las Vegas location.  Not so great.  Long waits.  Then more waiting to order.  Then more waiting for your food.  And then the food isn't the same as the other locations.  Maybe once it slows down the food will be up to par.

FmCQWSV5684CrpWgy6dB8A.text: This was absolutely amazing!!!   The portions were huge, the food tasty & the service was fast!!!  I love the check in on line process so we didnt have to wait too long.

da1j_KgRXoG-t4JgWmyiTQ.text: Ate here at 7:30 on a Sunday morning. No crowd, sat right down. Service was good, but the food was not. Eggs and bacon were obviously being cooked in large batches, then just plated as necessary. All of our scrambled eggs came out cold, and the bacon was pink and rubbery. After sending it back, the manager returned with made to order eggs and some of the same pink, rubbery bacon that had been heated up.  Ridiculous that they can't get breakfast right on a Sunday morning when the place is half empty.

2OgZdBexPOSe3xSfsSQ_uA.text: Went out for dinner the day before Christmas and found a 15 to 20 minute wait to get in. After 15 minutes we got in we're seated and within about 15 to 20 minutes we had our food. Good food, good price, will be back again. Oh, and Olivia was a gem.

7uqhVX-ZMCEHXyp1mv65Qg.text: I love Cracker Barrel, but we don't have it in my state.  I was delighted to find it in Las Vegas because I visit relatively often.  That being said, this location is not nearly as good as the locations I visited while living in Florida.  I still make the trip out for the Sunday chicken dinners though.  I always have to get the hashbrown casserole.  Beware the candy sticks labeling though.  When they run out of a certain flavor, they fill it up with a different flavor but keep the original label.  Ex. Last time I went they had run out of watermelon.  I didn't realize until I got home they replaced watermelon with bubblegum but kept the watermelon tag on it.  I was bummed to end up with 5 bubblegums when I thought it was watermelon.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love these candy sticks, and at 7 for $1 it&#39;s a steal.

Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday chicken dinner with hashbrown casserole and Mac and cheese.  Not pictured is the biscuit and cornbread that came with it.

571NZ0fGG3cMFduwI5KyEg.text: I had the worst customer service ever. Yesterday was my birthday and my friend took me to now my once favorite restaurant and I had a miserable visit. 1st we at least got greated and seated by very friendly lady named Cathy. Once my friend and I were seated our waitress walked by us no greating no asking what we wanted to drink nothing we were totally ignored. 10 min goes by and the bus boy I think his name was Jesus said he noticed we have been ignored and because he couldn't really assist us he would get us started. We'll the original waitress kept ignoring us. We finished our drinks the lady grabbed my friends glass for a refill never came back so I quit eating and was so upset I told my friend I wanted to leave. My friend asked for a manager he came and he was a cocky little boy after my friend told him what had happened he littlerly said I'll give y'all a super sized drink to go. It was like he was hinting us to get out. The look on his face was like he actually wanted us to go. Yeah he gave us a discount and didn't charge us for a drink he only did that to save his butt. No excuses my birthday ended bad because of your resturant. Y'all need a friendly manager and better waitresses. I'm sadden to say this was once my me and my mom's favorite restaurant now we will never go back. My mom and I really loved your restaurant we used to go every Sunday. I hope something is done about this.

psmmKADJjcKyQ9CjfbckvA.text: The Cracker Barrel's Country Boy Breakfast and Grandpa's Country Fried Breakfast are the best!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KVpws-WemrR9QwEmTbrP7w.text: The worst thing about this inexplicably popular restaurant is the wait. Why were so many people clamoring to stuff themselves with bland, mushy, carb-laden food on a hot day?  But, one our friends REALLY wanted to go there, and she was willing to go early to put our name on the list, so off we went. We did wait for a while, but we rocked in the chairs out front where it was shady and the time went pleasantly enough. Then, we were ushered in to be seated in the most crowded, noisy environment possible. They were cramming way too many people in too small of a space. Everyone was bumping the person behind them, the servers couldn't get between tables, and you had to take a scenic course to get to the restroom. etc. Hated it.  I vaguely remembered visiting a Cracker Barrel in AZ, and it being a pleasant experience. After my memory was refreshed by this visit, I remembered liking the cute store, the little peg games, and the hash brown casserole. Virtually everything else was an example of home cooking from someone who was not a very good cook.  The servers were pleasant enough, but they brought everyone's food at a different time; my sister's toast was cold and unbuttered, and they brought out rock hard butter LATER which could not be spread;my server asked which two sides I wanted with my sandwich then charge d me for both when it turned out there was only supposed to be one. (Her error- my penalty), etc.   These were only a few of the gaffes- followed by another unpleasant experience while trying to pay the check. They force you to go stand in line in the gift shop so you might buy some extra crap, and the little old lady at the register bungled the simple operation of check splitting so badly that some people paid for things they didn't order, but wanted out so badly it wasn't worth it to try and correct it.   Some of this could probably be attributed to a fairly recent opening, but there is nothing there that is good enough to warrant the trip, the wait, or the money. Some folks seem to think so but I bet I can guess who they're voting for for president, so disregard their opinion.

Q9DN2lzma4Rf8SvY2FobGg.text: Absolutely love this place! The customer service is outstanding and the food is actually really good close to homemade! Will def be a to go regular!

kWblU68tTIdSVmU1ATJ1gQ.text: It was ok. Had the hostess not bumped into our chairs or table every time she came around us without so much as an excuse me it might have been nicer. Britny the waitress was great.

Z4-6HVA6att4UeSOrWiLxA.text: We just finished a fantastically delicious meal at Cracker Barrel here on Vegas. I'm originally from Ohio and the food here is like home cooking to me. The green beans, they're what I come here for. They're exactly like my grandmother used to make. This is comfort food at its best. We had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated but boy it was really worth the wait. Service was quick and friendly too.

lputGUefyjQbIkzXdmd3uw.text: So excited that Cracker Barrel has opened. Had to wait about an hour but once we were seated our food was served quickly. Brian is one of the managers at another Cracker Barrel opening at North Las Vegas, super guy, stopped by twice to check on us to ensure we were enjoying our meal. Will be a frequent stop for our Vegas trips!

Ewyk3CYtFDKWy121wNAFZQ.text: Fantastic place to go with family or friends for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Great place to go with a group or party too. They have a nice store too for gifts.

zqMDGaRwQ192pB8uU7sVLQ.text: I was so excited to FINALLY visit this restaurant! Unfortunately within seconds of sitting down our waitress came over and asked if we were ready to order. I hadn't even opened the menu, I said we'll start with waters first a minute later she came back and asked if we needed more time. I understand they need to turn tables but geez let me look over the menu! I was so excited to have my breakfast but unfortunately most items came with eggs on the menu. I asked her if I could substitute the eggs for anything else. She said she would have to ask her manager, she did and the manager said it would be an extra charge. I was appalled that the manager and the waitress didn't even try to suggest anything and that they would take 25 cents off for the eggs! The food was mediocre you can tell they mass prep a lot of the food as it was cold, and the cheese has already harden from sitting out. Will not be returning here, so disappointed really wanted to love it.

UkczNj_EyCsAPyg_jybzjQ.text: It was busy when we went but what do you expect when going to a well known place on opening week. But the service was good and prompt. The food was great.

vMs1hpgAjBJepgOBF5TcpQ.text: The food was better than any Cracker Barrel I have eaten at but the wait was incredibly long & I felt like we were packed into the dining area like sardines!  My husband could not sit next to me because the person from the table behind us was halfway into his space! Probably won't be back for awhile until the hype of having Cracker Barrel in Las Vegas dies down.

tgSPzTATRIYgf2qbO_bmVg.text: Incredible service! A few things went wrong here and there but they went above and beyond to fix their mistakes. Very impressed. It's only been open a month but they are on top of things once an error is brought to their attention.   Also, incredible food. Obviously. It's Cracker Barrel.   In regard to the low ratings because of the wait, y'all obviously have never been to a Cracker Barrel before. There is ALWAYS a wait during normal meal times, no mater the Cracker Barrel, no matter the state. Expect 45-90 minutes on average depending on the party size. There's a reason there's always a wait; they're worth it!

BUPP_9iZzHn4bOqdWVXCNg.text: It is smaller than other Cracker Barrel restaurants I have visited. Wait was long, but, food was worth the wait, as expected

WH7GzIH9wQ-heg7joZ20kw.text: Always awesome.  Been going to locations in Utah for years- I don't think we have had a bad experience yet.  Thank you Cracker Barrel for never disappointing!

LpusD9Xl5pp-C079my333A.text: I'll come back whenever I'm in Vegas. Love the place and the service and especially, the food!

jA49WRIKgbTMA5cLjY6ehA.text: excited to see a new Cracker Barrel in Las Vegas as we have visited many of their restaurants on our travels...however we live in Ca and none exist there  Wait time at 10 am on a Monday was 20 mins, store was usual fayre and to us at least the main dining area seemed smaller than most of the others we have tried. Our server was Kassie and she was wonderful, friendly, efficient, attentive and ensured our food was cooked exactly as requested......eggs, well done turkey sausage, crispy bacon and of course perfect pancakes.  Our drinks were refilled when required and all in all we had a perfect breakfast and intend to return tomorrow before we return to LA  ps......also loved the warm biscuits and the warm syrup

9l6iPzXZTvjbRps8M1J_dQ.text: Great food, excellent service, staff was courteous and friendly. Love the biscuits and apple butter

uQmAJWF6p2EhawzidDwvhw.text: WOW this place was awesome. The food was beyond my expectations. Our server Lisa was amazing. I'm definitely comeing back

_S29IKbaXaePUobg2OLUKg.text: So I had dinner on Sunday at 6:00pm...no wait...very busy but I had a great waiter and delicious food. The Sunday chicken is a 10+...loved it. The manager stopped by to check on the status of my meal and satisfaction with my experience. It was excellent!

1SXXW8vqSgvmiQcLTqEQcQ.text: So today I finally got to try this place! I'm a mom of a 9 month old and don't get out much anymore. Lol. I took my dad and son to brunch and the waitress was very quick to get our order. Finally we ordered and she forgot a few things but brought them. No big deal. Then my dad got coffee and every time he saw the girl come around she went to every table but ours. He finally asked for a refill when the server finally came back. The food was good but the gravy wasn't hot. We loved the hash browns! Service was fine. BUT when we went to check out there were three ppl at the registers and while I juggle my son, diaper bag, and high chair cover no one acknowledges us to check us out. THREE ppl! I mean the guy is literally just looking at me struggle and still doesn't offer to check us out. Finally he goes "I'll take care of you here." Well thank you for finally stepping up to do your job. The two ladies were sweet and could tell I was irritated at his rudeness. There was no one else there but us so it was strange that no one wanted to help us. Anyways, I asked my dad to add a 20% tip and the guy literally tells my dad an amount to write which wasn't even 20% it was 30%!!! In what world is it ok for an employee to tell a guest an amount to tip especially when it's not even close to what I asked! They were lucky I was still giving the 20% but it wasn't the servers fault. And I never asked for his input. So my review is that they solicit tips here and don't have any country hospitality.

xQhO0kp8UzYfSUeJK5hkmw.text: Both happy and a little disappointed. The value for the portion sizes was fantastic. The ham was delicious and most of our food was cooked well. The grits came out cold. Our server took them back. When she returned, the dishes were hot, but the grits were still room temperature. I'm guessing microwave. I don't like microwaved food, so I didn't eat the grits (plus they were still cold). Both of my daughters' eggs came out fine, but mine were undercooked. Scrambled eggs, raw in the center. Gross. Bacon was fine, hash brown casserole was amazing, biscuits and gravy were good. Server had way too many tables. We asked for things three times and she forgot, the girl who brought my biscuits dropped one on the floor and said she'd bring another (she never came back, we had to ask the server). The tables were clean, hostess was great, we got seated quickly, bathrooms were clean, store was well organized and clean, paying our check was fast and pleasant. I'll give it another shot, but if I have a similar issue with the food, we won't be returning a third time. All food should come out HOT and fully cooked.

iXJWXWCVg0tXO3dNkfUxWA.text: Same great food that I've had at other locations around the country.  Yes, of course there is a long wait to be seated, this is normal and expected for a high demand restaurant that is opening their first location in this part of the country.

r2TkybitQzLqDdOngZ4mog.text: I read some of the poor reviews about this location so not sure what to expect. We are visiting LV and went here for dinner.  We have eaten at dozens of CB across the country and this had the best service of any of those.   Food came within 5 minutes of ordering.  It was up to the CB standards as we have come to expect.   Waitress was very helpful and attentive.   Beautiful new building with somewhat different design than most.  We give this location high marks.

ANw-2CyEeQTeSWm-HyBRmQ.text: I like their products I've bought in stores.  But their delivery in person leaves a little to be desired. The service was slow, the waitress forgot on persons drinks twice

HTtvJVUqZ6fNgMjH9j9kkQ.text: I grew up in Texas, where we have Cracker Barrel restaurants, but I can't recall if I've ever actually been to one. A favorite Yelp friend invited me to breakfast to check it out and we had a pleasant, tasty morning.  We tried a couple of the larger sampler plates and tried a variety of dishes- my favorite was the hash brown casserole (get it cheesy!), as well as the pecan pancakes. The grits and biscuits are solid as well. Most breakfast plates have eggs and at least one of the meats, and the chicken fried chicken is a good choice (only on the Grandpa plate!). Whatever you get, the portions are huge, so come extra hungry or expect to leave with a takeout box.   The biggest tip I can give is to go early (~8am) or on a weekday to avoid ridiculous wait times. If you do end up waiting, browse the country store or grab a rocker on the patio to pass the time. Even at the table, games are provided to engage with your group!

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sampler plates
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parking lot fish
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table info

nUOKeG42dEGN30ZdmiGW9g.text: My first time here and service was very friendly. Food was not bad. Surprisingly better than I thought. It's nothing to write home about but I enjoyed my dinner. We got country fried steak and the Cracker Barrel sampler. Hashbrown Casserole was delicious. Fried apples were delicious. Brussel sprout and kale slaw was surprisingly refreshing. Everything was piping hot and tasted freshly made. If they were a tad cheaper, the quality and quantity would be on par with the price. I would eat here again.

pAfVn7CxV9SKD_qhCRsKZg.text: What is the hype of Cracker Barrel?  I'm still trying to figure that out.  Packed parking lot, but a short wait to be seated for 3.  We waited no more than 15 minutes.  Service was definitely good here.  We were first timers so we rec'd some recommended selections.  Husband and I went with Uncle Hershel's plate, came with eggs, meat side and biscuits and gravy.  So strange, our b&g were served separately and with gravy on the side as well.  I was looking for it to be drenched with gravy.  Anyhow, decent food, nice service, some peg game to play while you wait for your food.  Oh! I did like the flavored iced tea...a squeeze of lemon, it was perfect.  I must say, prices were decent, good for traveling families.    Id try them again if there was one nearby where I live.  I would try breakfast...maybe pancakes or waffles.  Worth a try at least once if you get a chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chairs for sale
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry Iced Tea
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zGlW4gLTDGRhmRgjRRXfiA.text: Just a little taste of home!   Growing up with Cracker Barrel restaurants nearby, it was almost certain one meal during the month would be here.  I was happy one opened in the Vegas area.  The southern feel starts out with their 'front porch and rocking chairs.  The front of the restaurant serves as a gift shop full of treats reminiscent of the good old days.    We walked up around 8 on a Sunday morning.  Luckily we didn't have any wait to be seated.  Being a new business to the area we weren't sure.  Fortunately good service prevailed during our breakfast.  Refills were abundant and done very politely.    One thing I knew for sure was to order Mama's Pancake Breakfast. Why? For the Pecan Pancakes.  I have enjoyed them at various locations across the country and they have always satisfied.  Would you have guessed it? They were still great! They also offer sugar free syrup for crazy people like me.    In addition to the pancakes, mama's is also served with two eggs and sausage how you want them.  It's really a complete breakfast for me.    I enjoyed my trip down memory lane.  Ya'll check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of Mama&#39;s Pancake Breakfast- pecan pancakes
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of Mama&#39;s Pancake Breakfast- scrambled eggs, turkey sausage and cheese grits

Yj5UNmTlRaStYyesz8aCuw.text: Well.. I should've taken time to read reviews before arriving. Out server Canryn really made our experience a horrible joke. She didnt greet us when approaching the table, when taking our order didnt communicate with us (ask how we would like things cooked, what side we would like, ect.) she just stares blankly. She never came back to check on us or ask if we needed refills on beverages. Upon bringing my order my eggs were clearly not cooked the whites completely raw and I asked for my order to be remade. With a snarky attitude she asked "well how cooked do you want them". My family seemed okay with the quality of their meals but expressed they've had a better meal at iHop. Bottom line we would never come back and Camryn should consider a career outside of customer service.

eOVZwAYY80tihRvzemjskw.text: Cracker Barrel is coming to Bakersfield! in the meantime, I like the one in Las Vegas. Forst, it is close to Bass Pro Shop so there's that.  Second it is close to the South Point Hotel and Casino, our fave place to stay.  Third, it is soooo country style! Food like my mom used to make when she felt like cooking! It is all country style and I love it.  I hate grits, but even those aren't half bad at the Cracker Barrel.    I love breakfast best there, but lunch and dinner are smoking good too, I am told.  After eating, check out the gift shop.  There are bunches of really cool Americana and country style items there. They also sell things like their pancake batter, syrup and other items you may have sampled and liked during your meal.    I just love Cracker Barrel since my first time there with my wife's Auntie Ambie in Virginia! I can't wait to make it a breakfast hangout when they open here in Bako.  I promise I'll get in early and give you Yelptastic folks my review on the local location when it opens!

bUatK3YUXLIxn9AK8EOxWw.text: Service: our waitress was great came by all the time our tea and water glasses were always full never empty.   Food: we all loved our food the temperature was right and tastes fresh we were all full and happy that's always nice when you have another 5 hours to go before you get home.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad with grilled chicken
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids grilled cheese
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry pancakew

C2fH6gWW8y3nW8D2gRugdQ.text: Terrible Service. Had a party of ten, waited 35 minutes. Watched them put the number 10 in the wait list. Then tried to say we only had six when we clearly had 10. Then wanted to split us up into two Groups, when we came with family from out of town and we're leaving right after the meal. When we didn't want to split up the party, they said it was gonna be ANOTHER 35 minutes. Awful. Don't come here.

RfaojGl3BeCxmVaX7MaL2Q.text: News Flash!  Las Vegas has a Cracker Barrel! It's the first and only one on the West Coast!  So First Up! CB is across from Silverton, on your right side coming from Dean Martin BLVD...just follow the signs. Make sure when you go in, find the hostess podium or there may be one right as you walk in, Leave your name and how many in your party.  They'll let you know how long the wait is. Make sure you are close by the speaker system so you can hear your name being called when your table is ready!   Got two visits in, the first, on their grand opening day, the latter two weeks later.  Despite the wait times (1 1/2 hours and 45 min) Everyone seemed to be in a good mood. I killed time browsing thru the country store that was filled with boutiquey like stuff, kitchen goods, novelty foods and throwback candy.   They have plenty of rocking chairs, fans overhead, two industrial electrical fans, a water cooler on the front "porch" to keep everyone as comfortable as much as they can while waiting,  Food Just going to gloss over this part because not much to it.  I love Southern comfort- stick-to-your ribs and hips kinda food.  The biscuits are warm and fluffy, the corn muffins, buttery, chicken and dumplings, hearty, fried apples, yummy.  The open faced Hot Roast Beef Sandwich, was a disappointment. Not how Mr. B remembered having it when we dined in CB in AZ. The meat was tender, but they were skimpy on the gravy here.     If you compare this place to Black Bear Diner (the West Coast version of down home cookin) you'll be disappointed in the portions and overall taste from here.  Cracker Barrel was more on the bland side.    They also lack plating skills..lol...but that's just the foodtographer in me talking. Everything looked like it was just slung on your plate and moved down an assembly line. Nothing wrong with that, but my carrots looked lonely on that big plate.  Price It's great!  Budget friendly. Young families, retirees on a budget, or travelers will appreciate this place more. That's what the clientele make up here was.   Service Our experience was awesome both visits.  ALL the staff were upbeat and confident! Our server and her helpers were pretty efficient. Despite how crazy busy it was, our drinks got refilled, plates cleared out, no long wait on orders on both visits. The line was long on both times when we went up to pay, but we got thru it pretty quickly.   While we enjoyed the nostalgia and downhome aspect, for locals like me it's a one and done thing for now. It is a nice place to bond with fam and friends though, they 'll keep you occupied if your wait time is long!

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. each table has this puzzle.. Purty Smart!
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. front porch waiting area
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ... there, my plate of chicken livers looks a lil more pic worthy.

JyiPnhPa-uVaC7DAi9ce7A.text: On our way back to San Diego after Spring Break in Vegas & we just wanted to stop for a bite to eat before hitting the road.  Saw this place as we were driving by on the 15 & have always wanted to try them as we continually see commercials in town & have never seen one around, so we wound our way back to find a 45 minute wait, which made us think maybe it was a pretty good chain place to go... WRONG!  First, the customer service could use some improvement.  The lady out front taking names was friendly enough, but the waitress not so much.  Without being downright rude, she was about as unfriendly as you could get.  Very curt when speaking w/ you, sort of just drops the plate in front of you & if you want a refill or something, you practically have to turn into one of those guys on the runway of an airport w/ the light sticks to direct airplanes flailing your arms all around.  Second, the menu/specials are confusing.  They have a chicken fried steak breakfast & a separate one for lunch (only the lunch one is on the menu... other one was a special).  The breakfast one comes w/ 3 sides, none of which are any good... NO eggs, bacon or sausage (just things like mushrooms, etc.).  So, since you can't order breakfast items w/ your breakfast, I chose the lunch version & except for the French fries, the selections are just about as bad... enough so, the fries were the only thing I wanted as a side.  They offered to do 2 of the sides as fries, but not the 3rd for whatever reason, so I ordered a salad that my wife wanted.  & third (& most importantly), the food... practically inedible!  Not sure if all Cracker Barrels are this bad, but this one was disgusting!  Back to the aforementioned salad... it was basically a small salad w/ a TON of dressing on it... yuck!  The French fries were dry, stale & chewy. The chicken-fried steak tasted like it went through a conveyor belt, had some premixed breading that's stored in a plastic bag stamped on each side, flash fried & then flash frozen for shipping.  The gravy was pure white & tasted funky.  Literally the ONLY good thing here was leaving!

PyepCj1TajIAZLRMJzpMCA.text: First let me say that I love and grew up on visiting Cracker Barrel. With that being said it takes a lot for me to leave a one star rating but it has been coming since this location opened. Let me start by saying that ...yes we were one of the families that waited the two hour wait when this location opened. We were there July 25th!...their grand opening. This location lacks everything that Cracker Barrel creates...good food relaxed atmosphere and a feeling of "home". The staff overall is nice and the managers seem nice as well but everything is wrong. The food is just not up to standard.  Many times...too many to count ...our food has been lukewarm and not correct portion size. Honestly after this past Sunday visit of having grits with absolutely no salt and tasted very water down...I won't be going back. The country ham was like rubber. I had been told we are out of glasses so we are giving paper cups..by the waitress. They've been out of straws different jellies and out of biscuits... biscuits.... One waitress actually brought me a picture to show me that all the pans were out in the back because I was shocked that they didn't have any biscuits. It is loud and not a good design for people to be able to have conversations ...it feels like you're packed in like sardines! After being so excited that this chain was here in Vegas ...I'm very disappointed. Not the Cracker Barrel our family grew up on and have loved to visit through the years. I don't know what is going on internally but it needs to be corrected.

wvueIKS5cE2HEhA_TlvaYg.text: I use to eat at Cracker Barrels all over the country in my travels and really enjoyed them.  However, I have been to this location twice with different people and it was not the best experience.    I usually get the pot roast dinner and it was very fatty, the muffins were dry, and the service was average.  I also ate breakfast there and when I received the bacon, it was cold, not good "since I'm a meat and potatoes" guy and grew up in the Midwest.  Would I recommend this location, absolutely not.  Much work to do to bring it up to the standard that we the customer deserves and I know they can provide.  Hit a casino buffet, you cant go wrong!

XRbX08eWAJgw5j2dMvXm2g.text: First time here and loved it! Stopped by one afternoon because I was hungry and wanted to try it.  I had the chicken fried steak and pecan pancakes  absolutely delicious! Their corn bread and biscuits were bomb too. Overall, the experience was great!  Steve was an awesome server and the gift shop has a lot of fun stuff you can buy.

U7ahS6rPhiwy-o1Grwjfog.text: I'm giving this wonderful restaurant 3 stars for the following reason.  The wait time to get in on a Monday night at 7:30 was nearly an hour. And once we got seated it took over 30 minutes to bring our food.   I do want to clarify a few things though. This restaurant had only been open for 2 weeks. It is the first Cracker Barrel in Las Vegas. It's understanding that it would be busy.    When we checked in they said 40 minutes so we decided to wait it out.  I did like the fact that they had large rocking chairs and checkers to play on the deck. You could try them out and actually buy them from the store!  (Nice touch)  The food was extremely yummy. But not sure it was worth the wait. Good thing we had trail mix with us!   Will I be back?    Yes!  But maybe I'll wait until the newness calms down.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W_R93Fzn_aeymCbDgZD42g.text: At the request of family, we had breakfast at Cracker Barrel. I had no idea how popular and how busy this establishment was. Apparently it's somewhat iconic. And it's hard to believe because it's definitely not based on the food. Coming on a Sunday morning, we waited about 30-40min for a table which is normal for the time and day. While we waited, we walked around their country store filled with various items and holiday goods. The servers was very friendly and helpful. But I would never ear here again. The food was mediocre at best. The pancakes were dry and so were the biscuits. Everyone in our party felt similarly about the food. The food was on the cheaper side and so was the quality.

UfAxbks7tbE4MN_Cztw6-w.text: We went there tonight for dinner, this was our first time ever going to a Cracker Barrel. When we first walked in we enjoyed the surprise of a store with a lot of Knick knacks. We ended up buying a few things, but that is where the good experience ended. After we ordered we were brought some cornbread and biscuits, as much as you want to DO NOT EAT THE BISCUITS AND CORNBREAD!!!!!!! The cornbread is chalky and the biscuits have no flavor! Then our food came, mind you we should have walked out but we were starving. The steak was over cooked Had no seasoning what so ever. The corn and the Mac and cheese we just as gross. The country fried steak looked like someone ran over it and the gravy tasted like nothing but flour. We ordered our son some French fries to eat and they came about 10 minuets after we got our food. While we were waiting for them I joked well they can't mess up fries, but guess what!!!!!! The fries were still raw on the the inside!!!!! Needless to say this restaurant chain is on my band list and we will never be back.

MJL0BybD4U0tsEakfHJFtQ.text: Been here many times and was excited to finally bring my family when I was in town. It seems when ever you're trying to impress someone it never works out. Waitress (Nic) was irritated with my wife as my wife changed her mind a few times while ordering. Then here's the biggest one the plate we got to eat our complimentary biscuits on appeared to have BLOOD on it. I got up and went to find a manager and he (older bald man) said ohhh no it's not blood and took it back and brought another plate.  No apologies no "hey how can we make this right?"   Sadly I'm done here at this location.

YYcSBzt4sv8FiY3zwXeC6Q.text: This Cracker Barrel doesn't hold a candle to the ones back east. The service is average at best and the food doesn't taste like I'd expect at the Barrel. It's not seasoned right or something.

m3RhV_iYynlQTigtf_mpYw.text: Checked in online got here , got seated immediately which was great then waited for a server for 15 min. When he got to the table his excuse was they are busy. I'm puzzled checked in online walked in and seated immediately--- so how busy are you. ??? Not a good experience but patience is s virtue they tell me

qSJeUEr-eK4Y9pIQyt0OOA.text: This is my 2nd time visiting a Cracker Barrel on the west coast. My main purpose is to get a combo mix box of Goo Goo chocolate clusters from Tennessee. I love Goo Goo and this is only place I knows that sells it at the gift shop by the cashiers in candy section on the wall.   This time for lunch I ordered their homemade jam burger with bacon  instead of the combo platter I got last time that was just alright in taste but it was a huge portion.   That burger was excellent A+! I like that sweet taste with the burger and came with sweet coleslaw and fries. The free cornbread and biscuits was nice appetizer to start with.   This place is good if you want old country cooking. Next time I to try their meatloaf platter combo. Your experience will be different depending what you order. I remember I ordered their haddock  fish combo and the fish was bland with not much flavor.  So this place can be a hit or miss, depending what you order. Go for main course and if still hungry I would go elsewhere for dessert.

aKQPAQRPLATxlhW2CaXHzg.text: This is a great place to go for a delicious meal! Wait time isn't bad since you have a whole store full of goodies to look at. Service is always very nice and accommodating, but sometimes it can take a while to get food or any other requests because of the high volume of people. Overall, great experience and great food! The chicken is always a good bet to get.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signature Cheeseburger
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Chicken

HIOnmf-p4fjd0rQGJc4PTQ.text: Breakfast for dinner in Las Vegas...  In all of the years that I've been vacationing in Las Vegas, I have never been to Cracker Barrel. I'd see it every time from the I-15 freeway as I drove between Downtown and Belz Outlet (now known as Las Vegas Outlet South). I didn't even know what it was.   This time, we needed dinner and this restaurant was relatively close by. I was with the Yelpers from Los Angeles and they knew what it was. One had been to this location and the other gal had been to other locations across the US. The closest Cracker Barrel to LA is in Victorville...kind of a far drive...  So...it was time for me to get schooled. Cracker Barrel is a Country Store with a restaurant. We entered through the store and were immediately greeted with the fragrance of the Holiday Season! It was the scent of cinnamon, Christmas tree, and happiness all-in-one!  We perused the clothing, greeting cards, candles, candy, plushies, and more! Besides UNLV gear, there was a small supply of Golden Knights golf shirts. I snatched one up!  Yay!  On the restaurant side, the decor is memorabilia and knick knacks from days long past. I recognized a wash board, a coffee grinder, and farm tools. The fireplace caught my attention and I wondered if it's lit during the wintertime?  I didn't take photos of the menus because it's overwhelming! We got three menus: breakfast (served all day), lunch and dinner, and the specials. Wow...so many choices! I finally selected the Fresh Start which included a yogurt, blueberry muffin, fresh fruit, eggs, and Bacon! Yum! Chel gave me a dumpling (from chicken and dumplings) off of her Sampler platter and it was a good food exposure for me. Haha! I was full from the complimentary cornbread and biscuits (mmm), so I took them to go!  Jamie was our patient, good humored, hard working, and efficient server!  She endured our "jokes" and offered me a refill of my Holiday tea before I asked! Jamie brought us more Apple Butter when ours "slipped" off from the table and she made our visit a pleasant one!  I sure would return with more friends and family! This is such a comforting place with a warm, homey feel! It was a great kick start to our Holiday Season!

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Start meal: yogurt, blueberry muffin, fresh fruit, eggs, and thick, crispy bacon
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Do you know what this is?
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very spacious

yxSYF9DY-t_ZLvDWOhY-pA.text: My first time here.  Glad we came in tonight to have breakfast for dinner.  Before you get to the restaurant area,  you enter thru the store.  And what a treat it was.   Any little cute and nostalgic items you can think of, you will probably find it in here.  From old skool candies to the most beautiful nativity glass figurine I've seen,  I'm sure you ll find it.  Ok. On to the foods-  House biscuits and corn bread came with apple butter.  YuM!  While the rest of my company ordered their breakfast meals, I ordered their CB Dinner sampler which consists of ham (good), chicken dumplings (yum), and meatloaf (eh) with sides of the most delicious baked sweet potato ever (had butter and brown sugar on top, thank you!)  The other sides I chose were kale, brussel sprouts, and pecan salad and fresh fruit.  Loved that salad too, refreshing and super healthy too! Sooooooooo much food!   All flavors were amazing.   I just couldn't finish the entire plate even though I wanted to!  Our server was super sweet and I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kale and Brussel sprouts with pecans salad. Delish
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Winnah!!!

UvAGrqxDy2cFGCW6eekEPg.text: This was the worst experience I have had in a restaurant. Food came to our table and I noticed my fork was dirty. Asked for a clean fork, lady took it, then walked to another another table to take their order. Finally got my fork and noticed the plate was scalding hot, food was lukewarm as if it was put in the microwave. Ordered over-medium eggs, but they came out over-easy. Grits and gravy had a film over it...also as if it had been microwaved. Waitress finally came back to the table to see of everything was ok, AFTER I had eaten everything else. Manager came out and asked if I wanted new eggs, but by that time I had sat there long enough that my husband was already done with his meal. So I said No.  Food was horrible! Definitely not worth the $24.43 and + $5 tip I paid for.

vqN7fjLMbszFYtu__jIhGA.text: We came here twice during our vacation and drove 15-20 minutes out of the city to enjoy the breakfast.  The first time we came we were so blown away that we had to make another trip! The service is always amazing. The employees treat you like family.  I love this homestyle country restaurant.   BEST PANCAKES EVER!! Crispy, buttery outside with a nice and fluffy inside. It even comes with small bottles of warm syrup. The prices are very reasonable for the amount you get, which is a surprise cause this stuff is amazingly good! You can get 2 pancakes, eggs, bacon, sausage, ham and hash brown casserole for about $10! Such a score!  Wish they had a Cracker Barrel is Hawaii because we'd be regulars for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gOFkMyn2iURg8Fhm_upmmA.text: Well we have been wanting to try a cracked barrel for a while now, we don't have one in the Central Valley. So upon our trek to Vegas we found one and checked it out. We walked in and immediately were seated. The place was super empty, and the waiter told us it's usually busy but due to the holiday it was slow. The waiter was super courteous and attentive which I appreciate. I ordered the roast beef plate with mashed potatoes, Mac n cheese, and a side salad. The side salad was small and the perfect side. I wasn't thrilled with the mashed potatoes and gravy, the gravy wasn't flavorful at all. The roast beef was cooked to medium which I loved, but again the gravy wasn't that great and it lacked seasoning so I added salt and pepper. I was a but disappointed because I was wanting some delicious comfort food, but got a mediocre meal. On the positive side I can say I tried this place. As for going back maybe I'll have to try the chicken, I heard that was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn bread and biscuits
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fire place was gorgeous and grand
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast beef plate

DjxEFA6lXpR7ahJoCyefqw.text: First time and it didn't disappoint. The food I got was great and out of the four of us we all did some sampling of each other's and everything was good. Our waitress was on her game with a nice attitude and that's hard to find in Vegas sometimes.   We are going to definitely do Cracker Barrel again soon!!

QoTL3F52zoX3nO04PF4VQA.text: The food is as always amazing.  I got the buttercrunch iced coffee to go after having a mello yello while there, I also had breakfast for dinner--eggs, hashbrown casserole, smoked sausages and it comes with biscuits and gravy and grits--YUM!  My friends who were with me also enjoyed their food even though my friend Polly had to order a chicken salad thanks to the dice but she loved it...  The only problem we all had was that we felt very rushed.   The waiter brought our reciept 3 times even though we told him that we wanted dessert or something to go (like my coffee)   and then he asked if we wanted to go boxes twice while Polly was still eating....  I dunno, service needs to be better for us to return but the food is great as I said...  The country store is cool, I bought my friend a soap dish she wanted, I wish they still had my Naylor Mints, why did they stop selling those?  :(

TCZ4zrrHmSMlBZ9diwjYVA.text: This is a prime example why you should always look at the reviews. Something told me to pass it up. But it was very convenient and I was hungry. I would say it's below Denny's for breakfast. I had a chicken fried steak I'm traveling I hope the gravy on it doesn't get me 30 miles down the road. Staff was friendly.

YfzifaSoU7YmGaEqCB-w-A.text: Oh man, I have been enjoying their breakfast since the firsts time we discovered it about 7 years ago that we went to Albuquerque, NM. Their food is delicious, their service is always great and their prices are lower than any other chain of breakfast restaurants! Is a little above an hour drive from Riverside to Victorville, however it is worth it! I can't wait for them to open the one in Rialto, Ca. I highly recommend this establishment!

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dsIyuwwCADMquODBOLsK3w.text: My husband and I were in Vegas for the weekend and I was so happy to see a Cracker Barrel. The only time I had it was a couple of years ago in Orlando and I remember having a great breakfast. Well, we stopped for brunch on Saturday and of course, it was busy. We waited about 30 minutes to be seated which we were fine with and we ordered our food and drinks. The food was absolutely delicious; it tasted the way home cooked meals are supposed to taste and the atmosphere was cozy. The peach iced tea was BOMB. I keep craving it ever since. The one thing that stood out the most and the main reason why we look forward to returning to this Cracker Barrel location was the amazing service we received from Tori, our waitress/server. Seriously, she went above and beyond to make sure that we had everything we needed and that we were enjoying our meals. If she is still at this location when we return, I hope she gets our table! :)

Lpc56xY8blke6gK1F5VLHg.text: I wanted to come here to buy a Rocking Chair for my Parrots room but it won't fit in any of our cars. We would have to rent a truck. To bad because they were like 25% off or something like that. So no rocker as of the end of June 2019....

oWPLWM4qY9npmtS-f7LAgA.text: GREAT place for dining in,  great food and great service with attentive staff......As for ONLINE OREDERING, expect to wait 20 minutes after their time suggested online that your order will be ready.  Take a screenshot of what you ordered and DOUBLE CHECK at the time of pickup.  Not once has it been correct for me out of approximately 15ish times.   Other than the "Online Orders". Great!!  Good family atmosphere for the family though

DLz0FgYfrEcPrLklV3HXQA.text: This place is awful. I used to love the times we would find a Cracker Barrel on a road trip through AZ. I've been to this location in Vegas a few times, and it gets worse every time. It's ruining my whole love of Cracker Barrel. I hope it's just this location that sucks, and the whole chain hasn't deteriorated. They keep advertising their new fried chicken. Well they need to stop because it's awful. The coating is bland. The chicken is dry and flavorless. My wife had the chicken fried chicken which had too much breading. The service was pretty bad as well. We would ask for things, and they would come back and say "oh, I need to get that for you."  I asked the floor manager for aus jus for my daughter's steak. She asked for Med/well and it came out over well. Anyway, she walks to the back, and never comes out again. We tell the waitress, and it takes two tries before she actually brings it out. My daughter had about two small pieces of steak left when she finally got the jus.  Then there was a weird carnival vibe to the place. There was a guy sitting at a table across from us staring our way. Apparently, he was the waitress' boyfriend or husband. At one point she passes him, and sits on his lap. They were probably in their 40's, not teenagers. A couple at a table next to us made a comment to them, and then there was some awkward laughing. Not sure exactly what was said. I think the waitress should have her man wait outside or keep their interaction limited. Just seemed inappropriate in a family restaurant.  Anyway, that may have been my last visit to that location. I will probably try another Cracker Barrel to see if they have gone downhill as a franchise or if it's just the Vegas location.

jOTkDsAFb-8S6AZ0FyhCKw.text: Oh boy-- Cracker Barrel where have you been all of my life. How have I never been to this place? I came here early (around 8) on a Saturday morning and the wait was only 5 minutes. I was not familiar with anything Cracker Barrel. So this was really fun. I loved rocking in those chairs out front.   They called us right on time and took us inside. The place was PACKED!!! Wow it was amazing. We sat down and our waitress was there within seconds. She gave us great recommendations and we ordered the Grandma's Sampler and the Momma's French Toast Breakfast.   That food came out within 10 minutes. It was shocking because the place was so busy. But the food was hot and tasted great. The french toast was out of this world. I loved that it didn't have cinnamon in it because I am allergic. Those hash browns though--- wow. I think next time I will just order the french toast and a huge side of hash browns.  I loved that everyone looked so happy having their breakfast. The manager came over to check on our meal and that was nice too.   The store has a lot of fun stuff to look at. They even have old style candy for sale. Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Momma&#39;s French Toast Breakfast **
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best Momma&#39;s French Toast Breakfast **
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A bit of everything

Ip93JmCZeM3F2mAU7ka-5w.text: Dissapointed tonight with service and food.  Young lady was our waitress was very rude , just short almost as if she had something better to do. Took our order, maybe 10 minutes later part of our order came out so we had to ask for the missing items. Our original waitress never followed up with us so Jeffery took over filling our glasses and bringing us the missing items.  The food was bland, which is suprising. I have NEVER had such terrible service at this location as we did tonight. The table next to us had thier bill discounted 50%  because they messed up thier order as well, not sure if it was the same waitress we had as she just disappeared.  This will be my last visit to this location.

gC0oVzvMbAmhx6WI44h9Yw.text: Cracker barrel isn't all it's "cracked' up to be.  Puns aside, the food is uncredibly average. I always hear people raving about the biscuits and the pancakes, but after trying them for myself, i don't see what the big deal is.  My primary entree was the ribeye steak with broccoli, seasonal fruit, and a baked potatoe.   The steak was cooked medium well as requested, but was somewhat lacking in seasoning. The baked potatoe was a little overbaked. The broccoli was pretty good. The fruit was black eries. Blueberries, and pineapple   The customer service was fantastic, we were constantly being checked on to ensure everything was ok.  Food taste needs some improvement.

W0q8ELmAjGKTc6uyAyQ-1g.text: We waited for 30-ish minutes and the food was OK.  The food wasn't worth the wait. The service was OK. The only memorable part was the gift shop that they have in the front that they (maybe) should have made a little smaller to make more room for tables so maaaaybe there wouldn't be such a long wait?  They have their iconic rocking chairs sitting out in the front that you can sit on while you wait and also purchase if you like!   We were just here last month and I can't remember anything but the above mentioned. I am not likely to ever return...

d9s2uvHVzO8b0XYNJROLJg.text: First time coming to CRacker Barrel. Wow love the portions and how they give three sides. I love the hash brown casserole. The complementary corn bread muffin so good with butter and jam. The biscuit was all good but I prefer the corn bread. The services was on point. Lisa who helped us was so funny and friendly. I love a good waitress to make my dining great. Services is also important in eating out. And Lisa made it memorable.   We ordered the Haddock, country fried steak which to me needed more gravy and they provided more, meatloaf, pork chop specials, prime rib, and fried shrimp with mac and cheese. Our sides where fried okra, Mac and cheese, dumplings, hash brown casserole, baked potato, broccoli, Brussels sprouts with kale salad (only thing that I didn't like), corn ( my daughter didn't like which is weird cause she loves corn.) and fries.   Our dinner was amazing just a few sides we didn't like. But all the main dishes was excellent! I would definitely come back. I want to try the chicken pot pie (weds) and buttermilk fried chicken (Sunday). Which are on special days only!  Big parking lot. You may have to wait awhile if you plan on going on weekends. So either be put on the waitlist or come early. We went on a week night and it was not long of a wait they just had to set up a table and clean it.

St4nsLGcTllgjzaJJIGdJQ.text: Got the Roast w/ 3 sides... SO DISAPOINTED!!! The best thing in this pic is thw pancake!  Where is the meat?? This gravy is blah. No onions, peppers or potatoes.  Why would you put anything with a sauce touching other food! Dinner is not their strong point!
