n_cVZCVdkj7Ur3uu5272tw.text: I don't know what is the protocol for seating large parties. Our party consisted of 8 people. Waited almost 2 hours. I firmly believe that if we splited ourselves into 2 groups, we would've seated earlier. No one came by to ask for any refills for drinks and I felt a bit rushed. I know that the restauraunt was very busy but this is no excuse to pass on customer service. We have been vistiting Cracker Barrel religiously in Utah, but this experience left a salty taste. Too Bad.  Tip: come in smaller parties or salivate while everyone passes you.

9batigaBlbVi5sibFSN81w.text: Came here for my first time. Everyone told me to try it..I was so disappointed. I got biscuits & gravy and the gravy taste like flour. Their was a hair on my plate my French toast was not cooked all the way. And my bacon & eggs were cold. I won't ever come here again.

yLhIWxUyHKWbfIZSN_4X2g.text: WHAT HAPPENED TO MY CRACKER BARREL???  Last time we ate at CB was about 5 years ago, we traveled by road from California to Florida and back with virtually all our meals eaten at Cracker Barrel's along the way.  LOVED THIS PLACE.   We were excited to see a new location open on the way into Vegas.  With BIG anticipation we rolled in on Sunday morning for chicken fried steak and their (used to be) amazing hash brown casserole.   When looking for directions in Yelp we noticed only 3 stars which should have been a warning.    The portions are notably smaller and the much beloved chicken fried steak was merely okay but the biggest disappointment was the hash brown casserole which was so heavily laden in garlic powder the you could not taste anything else.   Was so excited to go but came to the sad realization that this was my last trip to which was truly an eating institution....  I might have given 2 or 3 stars if I didn't know how good it used to be

lnzQg4txaU_65C1hrNFhbQ.text: It's the Cracker Barrel, so you know what to expect. A place for big American style breakfast and a chance to shop for eclectic stuff. Always a fun atmosphere. Conveniently located off the freeway and near the airport. If you're hankering for that country atmosphere, no better place than this Cracker Barrel to savor it. Food is as expected, and service is always great!

qrgDA_aZHI_4hcz62Voutg.text: I absolutely love that you are allowed to order from the kids meal and be ANY age! The servers are kind no matter how busy they get, and everything I've eaten here has always tasted good.

WtjQSEk-cLpZmxdZMd9vTA.text: Had to wait awhile to get seated, but the hostesses are very friendly. Our waitress was great! We had the breakfast sampler, so big we split it. The food is excellent with a homemade taste. We loved the fried apples. Eggs were perfect, never had cheese in hash browns before but pretty tasty. Wish they had Cracker Barrel in California. Definitely a worthwhile experience. Our meal was $10, and worth more!! Will definitely go bac

sTyELXnljFDzfOW4zUQVqg.text: Service was very slow. Their check in system skipped us and after the 15 minutes wait time i was told, I finally had to ask and they didn't have our name down. We waited about 20 minutes for drinks. Food was an hour or so. Kids drinks tasted awful. Water instead. Great pancakes.

o-y1k4KwDfXbKAmR0OhfNA.text: Great food, with a fun staff. plus the store in front has plenty of fun affordable items to buy. The Mac & Cheese is bomb, also fried apples and chicken plate i believe it was Apple Cider BBQ Chicken Breast. We'll definitely return to this location.

wEl3KgEJEXqalGzIY2KjcQ.text: I was so excited to see a Cracker Barrel after moving back from the mid west.  I was fine having to wait 1 1/2.  And then it went down hill from there, I was seated in the corner which was fine until It took over 20mins to get water after flagging someone down. Asked to place my order only to wait another 1 1/2 to get food after talking to the manger  several times.  And he couldn't get anything right either.  Are food was fine, even though it was all wrong..... BEWARE!!!

6LYq9RdwAiChCqz1unSZbg.text: Well, I got that out of my system, once and for all. Not sure if I misremembered CB quality, or if quality has gone down that much in the ten years since I last ate at one. Either way, this cured me of ever wanting to eat here again.  The food reminded me of store-brand frozen dinners, like Banquet. Only that unnecessarily insults Banquet. The dumplings were anything but home-made, the chicken clearly not the real thing (tasted like the bags of frozen chicken cutlets you can buy at Target and Walmart where the labels advise that they've been injected with an 80% saline water solution, or something along those lines).  Fried okra had been fried long before. They were out of both honey for the biscuits and sweet potatoes. The cinnamon apples (identified as fried apples on the menu) were worse than mush.  And yes, the wait was long. The tables are crowded so close together you feel like you're at summer camp or in a high school cafeteria. Noise level is very unpleasant to the point of being stressful.  I won't be back. Especially since I literally just threw up while writing this review. When I sat down and realized how horrible the "ambience" was, I should've left.

zTeG0n1pU-JXplUloWT76w.text: Just finished eating here and since I always seem like I'm leaving reviews complaining about the way I have been treated I wanted to do the opposite today.  I would give the food 3-3 1/2 out of 5, but the service was definitely 5 stars!  My server was super friendly and went above and beyond.  And the clerks in the general store were great too!

LL3mkW4h82wQAzPR8SrqAA.text: I don't get the hype about Cracker Barrel. An egg is an egg. Nothing special and wait time is ridiculous.  I realize this is a new restaurant, but they taste the same throughout  the country. People should support local restaurants, not chains. If you have never tried the Sunrise Cafe, go there. Food is much better.

YpyiPL1q1il3M7n6mfgwzg.text: Our server, Karen, was awesome! The wait time was a little long. I expected that as it's a very popular place. When you come from a place that doesn't have Cracker Barrel, the closest one is always packed. Karen knew the menu and knew exactly what to suggest. My husband enjoyed his catfish and I enjoyed my ham, eggs and apples. The serving size is plentiful. If you want a nice, warm delicious country meal, this is the place to go!!

wvFDcqmGNYdhES0kmhFeFA.text: I love this place! Our waitress this time was Karen! Man what spunk!!!! She was funny! Definitely turned a bad experience (Liam ) into an awesome experience!!!! She had us laughing the whole time! Definitely an asset to Cracker Barrel! Gave as an off the menu tip... instead of Momma's breakfast... we got grandma's breakfast... OH YES!!!!!

Aucl72KTkxH1NbAi8ANlxA.text: I lived in Austin, Texas for 7 years and would eat there as often as I could. I was soooooo surprise that Vegas had one. I was not disappointed the food  is like you were still in the South. Service was outstanding and the staff GREAT.  There is one problem, I go Broke every time I am there. I WANT TO PURCHASE EVERYTHING!

BBIj-rK-EP1MpGxvEHhy3w.text: Went on a Sunday morning and had to wait only about 20 mins.  Service was horrible. We asked for refills on soda and the waiter kept saying ok one minute. Let's just say it was the longest minute as we never received refill. Also asked for hot sauce, again waiter said I'll bring it right back. All he brought back was the bill. I guess since it is open for a few weeks the staff rather get you in and out instead of making sure you'd want to come back. Not worth the wait or drive there.

j19Yu1EW11o6Fo4WfsKYTw.text: What a fun "store".  We had a nice breakfast.  I didn't care much for the gravy, it was a bit bland but loved the bacon. We enjoyed the pancakes and the muffin but the round sausage wasn't great  maybe it was the brand  service was outstanding!!  Wish we had more time to shop in the store.  We will definitely be back.

p_7BAlzQjKcXQu_t6CI5ZA.text: I have been here a few times.  I can't say it has been consistent.  There are alot of options and I believe the menu was recently upgraded.  The service was good despite appearing to be short staffed.  The server graciously fixed a small mistake with the order.  My plate was missing my side of hashbrowns.  She handled it well.  I will go back and hopefully have a more detailed review to update you on.

IBmk3EsPDOUtqZhtNLUVKA.text: Before leaving town my last few driving visits to Vegas, I've stopped here on my way out of town. Got on the waitlist while shopping at bass pro and checking on the mermaids at Silverton. The estimated wait time was correct. It was a Sunday, and I saw the picture if the advertised Sunday fried chicken.  I ordered the chicken with kale salad and mac n cheese for my sides. Did combo of corn muffin and biscuit. Everything was delish. Huge portion.  Brought half home for dinner. Our server was great. She was friendly and attentive. Only glitch was when we asked someone for a bag for our containers and they said to ask up front.  Asked the hostess who said as a cashier. Ask the cashier who said ask the server. Went back to the table and asked the manager who was walking by, who said ask the cashier. I said I asked everybody and they keep sending me to someone else. So he personally brought us bags. A little miscommunication amongst the staff I think. Just bring a bag when you bring the to go container. Our waitress was great, even though we were her last table, she didn't rush us and offered us to go cups for our ice tea. Much better experience than my visit prior. The Sunday chicken is the bomb!

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried  boneless chicken  breast
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tN1i357JJ4L7boy6s1mFjw.text: First of all we went to Cracker Barrel and waited awhile but that is ok.   They were busy.    I guess they had all the corporate people there.    Well we finally get in and sat for 20 minutes before anyone said hi.  We didn't even know who our server was.   Someone who worked the other side of the place was bringing someone food and she stopped to see what was going on.    They bring out the meals and they looked like kid meals.   For us girls it was ok since we were having banana pudding but not for a guy.   My husband sent it back and didn't even eat.    The food was cold because it probably sat there for awhile.    Then they bring one banana pudding out.   Doesn't even look like the picture.    So then after a very long time they bring two out and don't even put the Carmel on top.    He said he wasn't charging for the desert.    And I told the manager I don't see why I would pay for any of it.    He took care of it.     But the food made me sick.   Won't be back

fdBtQPxHZpqWeEEjA5iGSg.text: Travel in the mid west and east coast and love Cracker Barrel but on vacation in Vegas and had a terrible time here.  There was no wait for a table Sunday 6/16/19 evening so that is a sign the business is in trouble at this location.  The waiter had a great attitude and has a great memory can remember what drinks you order.  But when he brought the food out each person in the party was missing a side order.  No apples with the breakfast and gravey butter but no biscuts.  What does cracker want us to do with gravey and butter?   Also missing hash brown.  The manager I think her name was Elle came to the table but was hostile with me because I could not remember the exact name of what I ordered I ordered the big boy breakfast and was calling it the poor boy breakfast. Here is the IQ level of management at this place how many breakfasts has boy in the name.  She could not figure it out just by looking at the plate?  Does she really work for you guys or a temp manager?   My daughter saw here chew out some other customers very loudly about 20 yards away.   Funny how this manager takes things out on the customer.  Is Cracker barrel management morons?  Why is it my fault her staff forgot side orders?   the waiter came out and was in shock and said they did not bring that out?   he was the one bringing out the food.   I travel for business and saw Cracker on the side of the road with full parking lots and stopped in and fell in love with the food and service but when I tell my family and take them on vacation to Las Vegas or Orlando the service is terrible.  I was in Boise for two weeks and eat there every morning and to prove this there is a gentleman who is there every morning and sits in the same seat.  We were the only two in the place early in the morning.  I had great service breakfast and dinner for two weeks not one mistake.  I got to this Las Vegas location and the services is S.   If you have a problem with process fire management there.  If it is personnel then pay more in Vegas but your quality is killing your reputation since the majority are people on vacation and may be eating there for the first time.   Also note for low IQ executives I walked in and was seated right away and had to get my family that started shopping in the store.  There was no over flow of business that could have caused this lousy service.   Fix it.

qbnYkUEv_eYoMC8veYKOew.text: Get the grilled catfish! Amazing! So are the turnip greens. Absolutely loved the service we received! One of the most pleasant experiences at a chain restaurant!

V_eS9m4L_Tgpp2v_BEKTBg.text: Love the old school favorites, grits, pinto beans, fried apples and chocolate cola cake!

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c3VdTOTnejNYYCFgrgO9-A.text: Upon arrival to this location, we could tell that the staff seemed disorganized.  We waited in a line to check in, and everyone was being seated as they approached the counter.  The restaurant had plenty of staff and it was not full, maybe half of the tables had paying diners at them. When we were seated, the server Dina, came over to take our drink order.  We ordered our drinks and a dessert item.  When the dessert item was ordered, she seemed confused and quite irritated asking if we were going to be dining or just getting the dessert.  When we let her know we were going to order food she let us know she would grab our drinks.  When she brought back our drinks, she asked if we were ready to order, and I informed her we would need a minute, since we just got there.  Not even two minutes later she came back asking us if we were ready to order, she seemed very rushed, so we ordered our food, my sister ordered a salad, and I ordered the chicken BLT, and our friend ordered the Country fried steak.  When I ordered my food I told her I did not want the coleslaw, and told her I wanted NO BACON on the sandwich.  Then I asked if they had turkey bacon instead, and when she told me no, I told her "okay, no bacon then."  We also ordered a side of biscuits.  When the food finally arrived, it was not our waitress and we only had the country fried steak and the chicken BLT.  When seeing the chicken BLT I informed the waitress that this would need to go back because it was not supposed to have bacon on it.  She then took it back, and not five minutes later Dina comes back with the same sandwich with the bacon removed, and an extra slice of cheese thrown on the top.  If the problem was just a bacon removal, I could have done that myself, but the fact that they decided to just take the bacon off and give it back is an entirely different issue.  I then told Dina that I would not eat it, and she immediately got an attitude and told us she would get her manager.  We then waited while the rest of my party ate their food, no manager ever came to the table for that issue, and after that point we never were served again until my sister called over the manager to ask about the biscuits we ordered that never came.  She informed us that they were making a new batch and that she would bring us some as soon as they were done, this was at the end of our meal our waitress never informed us of this.  We were not helped again or asked how our meal was until Dina came to the table to give us our check.  I cannot believe how terrible this experience was, and I do not think I have ever received this terrible of service EVER.  The fact that Dina never got her manager for my table, and I sat there with no meal, not by my choice, but because I was never offered another meal was just insane.  What was even more insane was that I was never offered an apology for the mistake.  I came here to enjoy a dinner with family and a friend and I sat there for an hour and a half with no food, and no service.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Notice the extra piece of cheese thrown on top of the left over bacon imprint.

Wo1NkL_5_QI031opU66AVw.text: Unhappy...between the wait to get seated and to get the food I am pissed! We were told the wait was 45 minutes and ended up waiting for over an hour. THEN when we were finally seated the wait to get the food was almost 45 minutes and the food was luke warm! My eggs were wrong so I had to send my food back which made me madder because I had already waited ALMOST 2 HOURS!  The cornbread that was brought to the table was ROCK HARD.  I cant believe they would send that out for someone to eat!  When a manager finally came over he was in training, didnt offer to comp ANYTHING or give a token for the inconvenience. I felt like he was sent over to pacify me.  I ended up speaking to the manager Christine of the restaurant who was apologetic and did compensate for the issues but I know for a FACT I won't be back on a weekend.  No pictures because the table has since been cleared. I started off giving one star but bumped it up to 3 because of Christine.  BTW the food was flavourful.

v2vUkIb0YOMsGeVLn7RDKg.text: This was pur first time eating here. The employees were very friendly and we loved all the vintage decorations around the restaurant. Our waitress was very nice and explained everything to us. The food was amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very cool vintage items in the restaurant
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U4PJ1ea_G4vY2nZDrLPUuA.text: I can describe Cracker Barrel in one word: CROWDED!!!  My family and I went here twice and ate here once. The first time we came we were told that the wait is an hour and 10 minutes. No way. So we got smart for the next day and went to the website where you can add your name to the waiting list. Once we arrived, it was a 15 minute minute wait.   During those 15 minutes I spent my time in the "country store" looking at useless stuff for sale. I remember that other Cracker Barrel's in the south sold cute things and yummy treats. This location has very few treats and a lot of junk. Even so, it was wall to wall people and very hard to get around the store.   We were seated against the wall and even with the shade drawn down I had sun beating against the side of my face and the other lady had sun directly in her face. Nothing could be done about it except squint. When the meal was almost over, the sun did move so it wasn't so bright.  I ordered pancakes and eggs, two ordered meatloaf, and one ordered chicken fried steak. My pancakes were really good and cooked just right. Fluffy on the inside and a crunch on the outside. Grits were served but they weren't that good because they were runny. Biscuits and cornbread came but neither were very tasty. Easily skipped.   The service was wonderful. Overall, I would come back here again but I'd never come without putting my name on the wait list first. It's not the best food but it's nostalgic and I guess that counts for something,

P-kj_-kSzhlLBL5GQNusTA.text: My friend says he LOVESSSS this places and wanted to go so I said ok....  The wait was told to us 20 minutes but was less not bad didn't mind.... out server was GREAT no complaints on her she was AMAZING   I ordered the meatloaf with Mac n cheese greens and a side salad my side salad came out first was normal for a side salad no complaints   I guess they don't give out complimentary bread you HAVE TO ASK so make sure you ask if you are not given any!!!!!   The wait for food is LONGGGGGG.... I got my food and tried the greens first I'm a greens lover .... blahhhhh NO FLAVOR WHAT SO EVER AND COLD...I tried the Mac and cheese next it was "ok" wasn't amazing but wasn't bad....  my meatloaf was barely warm :( I took two bites and couldn't do I would rather feed it to my dog honestly!!! I won't go out of my way to visit here again!   My service again was GREAT And the people working were AMAZING but the food got to step it up no one likes tasteless food and cold .....

Uk_OG2txzlFrjKvvjlT6sw.text: I went here for my very first time on a Sunday afternoon with my husband. We knew they were going to be busy since it was the Sunday brunch crowd. We waited an hour and thirty minutes for a table just for the 2 of us. The wait wasn't too bad, we looked around the store and sat on their rocking chairs to kill some time. After our long wait, we were called on the overhead and got seated right away. They have a fun little game on the table to play to kill more time while you wait for your food. The service was good and the food was even better. My husband got the French toast and I got a children's chicken and dumplings and biscuits and gravy. I defiantly recommend the chicken and dumplings.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Children&#39;s Chicken and Dumplings, a side of hash browns, sausage and gravy, and French toast.

1lMGpjS9irIodoyTk7bX9g.text: Not sure why this place only gets 3 stars.   Place was awesome. Excellent service throughout our meal.  Coffee was really good.  Chicken Fried Steak, biscuits and grits were really good as well.  The French Dip was the best I have ever had.  Place was packed with people so I guess they didnt pay attention to the ratings.  Would definitely recommend to anyone.

p9syv6vnDAlCJECBcHoGtw.text: I HEARD SO MANY GOOD THINGS... before the vegas location opened. I was easily disappointed. I came with my whole family which was about 3 or 4 tables earth of people. They accommodated us nicely despite how busy it was and how cramped the dining area is buuut my issues were mostly with their food. First the portions were so small!!! My cousin finished his food with the quickness before mine even came out. I was excited fo dat hashbrown casserole but it had some hard parts and just seemed like it had been sitting out for awhile. They food was so bland and didn't have much taste. Also their cornbread is not the sweet type because I thought it was going to be. One good thing I have to say is that our servers were pretty great especially since we had such a large group. But still i definitely wont be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saddest looking plate.. so disappointed :(

B1jFtnl5SgTe07y2TgurTw.text: The service was great. I checked in online and was seated as soon as I checked in. The manager (I believe) was very nice, he came by to check if everything was great. First time visiting this location. The food was really good and warm. My daughters Mac & cheese was delicious, It's a big serving. They gave us a plate of biscuits and gravy for the table. The checkout was very fast. From the hostess to the cashiers everyone was genuinely nice.

kxpHkLdzuxCyg_eaCxTopQ.text: ***Cracker Barrel, a popular country kitchen restaurant chain in the Midwest and the South, now has a location just off The Strip; the food varies from okay to satisfying, but the portions are incredibly generous***  Las Vegas has brought in many big brands and chains recently.  There is a White Castle now.  A Shake Shack.  Now, there is a Cracker Barrel, which is located just off The Strip next to the Silverton casino and hotel.  Cracker Barrel is a chain business that features a restaurant and a faux general store selling dry goods provisions and seasonal items.  The general store offers several items that are probably a waste of money (or at the very least, just items you probably do not need).  The general store though makes the potential long waits you may experience at Cracker Barrel more tolerable.  It also does feature a few fun things like a variety of packaged snacks and sweets, which includes some hard to find and nostalgic candy options.  Cracker Barrel always features seasonal decorations.  The restaurant at Cracker Barrel offers great value.  You can get breakfast all day.  Lunch and dinner are also served.  Most of their lunch and dinner options are in the $9 to $14 range and feature very generous portions.  I had the chicken n' dumplins platter.  The portion of chicken n' dumplins was very generous--lots of chicken breast meat and a fair amount of dumplins.  The chicken breast was fairly good for chain restaurant chicken (it was not too dry).  The dumplins were good.  They had a good chicken noodle quality even if the dumplins themselves were a little doughy.  Unfortunately, the chicken n' dumplins as well as the standard offering of mashed potatoes and gravy were both lukewarm in temperature.  The platter came with 2 additional sides.  I had the turnip greens with ham hock.  The ham hock was a tad salty while the greens were quite bitter (even more bitter than I was expecting).  The fried okra was decent.  There was definitely quite a bit of fried batter so you kind of lose the okra flavor.  The platter was finished with 2 mini cornbread muffins.  They were quite crisp on the outside.  I wish they were a tad sweeter.  Service was very friendly and quick.  Prices are good as they are not too expensive and you get very generous portions.  In terms of decor, Cracker Barrel has a faux old timey look.  Cracker Barrel is not a bad option for large families looking for a lunch or dinner before they get to The Strip or after leaving The Strip.  Cracker Barrel offers free self parking.  The lot is big and it is easy finding and open space.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cornbread muffins
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turnip greens with ham hock, fried okra
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken n&#39; dumplins with mashed potatoes and gravy

7dB8WwVIfOfEjsCG-niybw.text: We visited on MLK day.  Was happily surprised to arrive and there not be a wait. We were seated quickly and by cheerful staff.   How can you go wrong with the pancakes from Cracker Barrel? You can't!  They are the most delicious flaky fluffy stacks of goodness ever and the warm bottles of syrup are full of flavor.

oA9KGj9dgGywXCA8Z4W-pg.text: Two words...sweet tea. Order it. I cannot tell you how refreshing it is in 120 degree heat...yes 120! The chicken fried steak was good, but the biscuits...sweet Jesus they are heavenly.

2cDfH2r5fDditWx2T3h-XA.text: I have been to the cracker barrels in the south and this gave me a good reminder and the apple butter left on the table was great. This place does need to work on their biscuits though because they are just not as fluffy and big and the grits were too watery but I just love this place overall and setvice was excellent

clL5UkMYKSq2w9gfeaBCUw.text: Im a first timer. Although not my hubbies first time, and i was excited to try it out for His birthday we waited 1 hour, which was not bad bcuz according to the hostess the longest was 3 hours.  Once we were seated we were attended quickly.  Our drinks were served almost immediately.   The waitress brought out a chipped glass cup which a shard of glass fell into the water, thank God we noticed that quickly.  I ordered the French dip sandwich with a side of dumplings, the dumplings were barely warm, the sandwich however was amazing, but i wasn't brought my au jus 15 minutes after the manager had noticed that we we're trying to eye down our waitress who was busy, the manager took care of our issues , the chipped cup, the soda refill and the au jus for my sandwich, and his biscuits (which may or may not be frozen)   My husband had the "grandpa fried steak" he had a side of biscuits and gravy.. grits and loaded hash brown casserole, the cheese on his hash browns were "warm and ugly"  The fried steak very flavorful though, the grits were "alright" and the gravy was also on the verge of being cold, and the biscuits were brought out later along with the au jus and the drinks; and by then the gravy was cold and not much intriguing to eat with hot biscuits & cold gravy.. also the fact that our waitress told us that our "blue berry muffins were frozen" so they would take longer to be ready, but she had us confused with the couple next to us who did order the muffins ... the fact that they are frozen was a turn off, because you'd think being a "southern " home feel restaurant you'd make Your breads /muffins fresh. Would we return?  Possibly but not to the Las Vegas One, On top of waiting for such a Long time to be seated and wait for food that isn't to the standards that you'd assume a highly recommended sought out restaurant would have, but missed it... we'd probably would go to another location in our home state.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h-uYNJnM7od5pqr9bv6lAQ.text: First timers to C.B. Customer Service was awesome from the cashier to our waitress (Amanda) Food was superb! We will be back to this location when we're in town.

q1wHamuKqAB4j3G92oXaBw.text: Slow motion in this spot! Wasnt too busy but pretty slow service on all aspects.  Food was good. The older woman with short white hair needs a lesson in customer service, very rude the way she speaks to ppl. Doesnt look at all happy! I wont be returning to this location primarily due this woman's attitude and lack of communication skills. And im staying in the casino hotel for 2 weeks located in the same parking lot! Cheers !

04GgsO41nPpS5YYTDFY9Qg.text: Wonderful breakfast three meals ordered and plenty of food for four. Great gift shop. We found the nicest gifts for others.

WPefdb8m3-dQB6kkyoca3g.text: Came to this restaurant for brunch with my momma. Wait was relatively short - considering it was Saturday morning. But the time waiting for our table flew by because we were able to spend our time inside the lovely shop they have. The little store was filled from the ceiling to the floors of mostly fun little nic-nacs, family games and more.   Breakfast was good, and filling. Large portions and the price was relatively normal $10-12/person. I had the grilled chicken BLT and my mom enjoyed a large breakfast with pancakes and all. Honestly out of both of our meals- the pancakes were the most memorable. Food was nice, restaurant is clean, and the service was great.   I will visit again in the future, but it is not on the top of my list for brunch joints.

b4S_by7xNbIlY5zSPUgm5A.text: Terrible terrible terrible!!!!  What the heck happened to this place?!  When this place first opened the food was on point, service was impeccable (southern hospitality at its best), and the people who worked there seemed to love their job.    Fast forward tonight...THUMBS down .  The only 1 Star is for the host/hostess who sat us.  Our server wasn't pleasant at all.  She seemed unhappy to be serving us?!!  She served us before and was a lot nicer and eager to be there.  Maybe something has changed within CB employee affairs?  Whatever it is, she was wasn't happy.    ***Side note:  while we were waiting for our order, my son asked me for crayons because he saw another customer's child coloring - I asked one of the employees who was standing by the fireplace (doing nothing but observing everyone) if she could bring my son some crayons and she immediately said "sure".  A few moments later she comes back empty-handed like she totally blew off what I just asked her like we didn't just speak.  Mind you, she wasn't doing ANYTHING but standing by the fireplace.  I finally got up and just walked over to the hostess and asked for some crayons myself in which she happily gave to me.  I walked by the employee standing by the fireplace with the crayons and she looked at me like she had no idea??!!  {Get it together CRACKER B!}  Customer service went out the window!!!  What the heck happened to this place?!!  For a chain restaurant this location is NOT keeping up w/CB standards!!!    We won't be coming back here again - I agree w/the other Yelper: Jennifer S!!!

JEhPoA9eFP2b1pqa4g8oaw.text: Went here the Saturday before Mother's Day with my wife, my mom and kids and I gotta tell you, we were extremely disappointed. The 2 stars is probably literally for the service. I ordered the Catfish with Mac and cheese and fried Okra. Fried Okra was pretty good, but the Mac & Cheese and Catfish was sooooooo bland. Like, no flavor at all. I got a side of Gravy to go with their "World famous biscuits". The gravy was also bland. Biscuits were OK, not certain how they are world famous.  My Wife had the all american cheeseburger, which she said was the most bland, non flavored burger she has ever had in her 30 years of life.  Of course our kids enjoyed it because they're kids and don't know any better and my mom said her Chicken Gizzards were good but not justifiable for the whole meal. My wife's first experience at a Cracker Barrel was in Dallas and she said it was the best restaurant she's ever ate at. I'll probably give Cracker Barrel another chance.........in a different state.

Ohb8JXB30BgT9VQX37L_uw.text: No complaints about the store, merchandise or servers. FOOD is the complaint Tastes old and dry. Like it's been sitting under a heat lamp. Chicken fried steak  gravy like glue  dry biscuits All around not fresh.

b_kahnPvToOin9s1u9TGZQ.text: I'm being working on costumer service for 13 years, start as a dishwasher and then as a cook, server now I'm a general manager for a breakfast restaurant, this please here is the most unorganized and unprofessional place . I don't know if they are under staff or they employees just don't know how to do their job, hire someone who knows how to run you business...

98p8P03I9XutSckvLa4Eew.text: This was my first Cracker Barrel experience we waited for an hour for our party of four to be seated. It was the morning. The menu to me is very cafeteria food like. There's no omelets or potato options besides a hash brown casserole. The bacon tasted terrible, the sausage is the size of a half dollar, the ham was decent, and the coffee tasted like diesel fuel. There are no gluten free options and definitely not the healthiest menu. Grits served with most dishes. Would of liked more fresh lighter ingredients. Wouldn't return as the food wasn't worth the wait or the price.

wHwfS9vVChu3AVe4oa5f4g.text: Came for the experience, left full. That's about it. The wait was annoyingly long but atleast they had plenty of rocking chairs to sit on and wait. Staff was friendly and the food was average. The one thing I didn't like was you had to leave the restaurant and go next door to the store and pay for your food. Would I come back, not sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YyxtYuhH4GGdzoIk6PjuoA.text: Loved ..it so much we wanted to stop for breakfast before our trip home. What a disaster.. our experience for breakfast was horrible the manager ended up taking our order after twenty minutes of waiting for our waitress.. Fifteen minutes later food came out luke warm everything was already starting to harden over. Finished eating ten minutes later still waiting for our  check... waitress no where to be found. Went to the manager and ask for the check explained the horrible experience.. She didn't seem to care considering everyone else was complaining too. Took our check and moved along to pay.. Cashier line was horribly long cause everyone was complaining about the service sad. At cashier another  female manager stood carelessly listening to all the complaints really had nothing to say. I'm so  confused on how our first experience was so wonderful and our second was so horrible. Continuity of service is extremely important also good management I important to. We won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States

53kt1ZVysWtLwtugiz65iA.text: We went here for Easter. The ham was over cooked and very dry. The pancake was expensive $4 something for one small one and it was stiff!! This is my second time to come.. won't be coming back again!

jMA3ZeVGmZttboZzP3AWJQ.text: Got the chicken and dumplings. Not impressed. About 4 small strips of chicken, probably about an ounce worth. The rest of the plate was just doughy dumplings. Baked sweet potato was on point.

3Zxoaa-0xPWihFyAgBTZuw.text: Stopped in this afternoon to get some dinner to go.  What a complete waste of time. I walked up to the to go counter to place an order and an older lady asked if I needed help? I said yes I would like to place an order to go. She replied,Do you know what you want? I said yes, so she calls on the radio that there's someone up front who wants to place a to go order. Than looks at me and says she will be right with you. I wait and after about 5 minutes she tells me that Taylor is swamped and she will be right with me. So I walk around the store mind you I'm the only one trying to place an order. So I ask the girl standing at the podium for a menu while I wait. Again I wait a good 10 more minutes. Finally I just drop the other stuff I was gonna buy with our dinner and walk out. I don't get making someone stand there for a certain person to take your order? There were 3 other people in the front that could have helped me or acknowledged I was waiting. The one guy Jordan had to tell the blond girl standing there on her phone, texting I presume to answer the phone cause it was ringing. Awful that this place is run like this.  The ones back east aren't like this place at all  Gonna be done with them for awhile anyway. Food at this one is mediocre anyway.

Sal9mCo-seBSXnvEHUo8DQ.text: Dumplings with no taste , Over cooked hard fried chicken with  lousy spices  I thought this place was good but after two tries I have to say that it's awful

DGB3YawswW-Lklxjhx8n3Q.text: Only eaten here a few times while passing through Las Vegas. Always great service and good food. Nice family setting.

F99DqoI0CqC3zAK22MVO-w.text: First time visiting. Totally neat restaurant with a country store in the front. We went in the middle of winter, so the store was a treat from the cold air. Ordered the sunrise sampler. I was not disappointed. Big variety of food. Scrambled eggs, biscuits and gravy, hash browns, ham, sausage and bacon.   After visiting, we will return. A great place to sit and eat.  Southern feel and cozy.

kY3l31hJCZjsMRtAJH8uBg.text: Server Tyrone was outstanding!  Super polite and intuitive in terms of my needs.  Staff in general was extremely friendly.  The food was good, not great.  I just came from a trip where I ate the same (awesome) Cracker Barrel breakfast 3 days in a row and this location was a bit weaker.  The sliced tomatoes were not fresh, sausage very dry and the grits were WAY too soupy.  On the other hand, the coffee was killer & the cook nailed the egg whites.  All that said, it was a really good experience and I recommend this location.

rXLo6ADlmjndLPbYdKelKg.text: Had breakfast here today. Had to send the eggs back twice! The first time the eggs were barely warmer than room temperature. The second time because they were lukewarm! The manager seemed unbothered by this poor cooking, not even apologizing at all. Along with the eggs, I had to send the ham back because it also was lukewarm and soooo dry. The only good thing and hot thing they served us was the hashbrown casserole. I used to like Cracker Barrell, but I probably will not visit this one ever again.

aKFHoT9yvbDjtC6U7Gqthg.text: New Cracker Barrel in Las Vegas, new menu item (fried chicken), gotta try!  Mistake.  Service was slow, but when the wait staff did arrive, they were forgetful at best, obviously overwhelmed and understaffed.  Examples:  couldn't get silverware, even after food arrived.  The order was missing side dishes and had to make several requests for items they forgot to bring.  The food was just average, nothing worth a repeat visit. The final inconvenience and indicator of poor management was the long line of people waiting to pay their bill at the single cashier on duty.  Restaurant patrons had to contend with gift shop souvenir purchasers in the same check out line.  Ridiculous.   Never again!

Z8C4sMgiwPzg2B470hjsHg.text: I am glad that they brought a Cracker Barrel to Las Vegas! I used to live in Midwest and I always love going to Cracker Barrel with my family! I go for the country fried steak and eggs!! The apple butter is delicious!! Love this place!!

yk4eOzpSuVbHcdvDaIylCA.text: I'd heard so many great things about Cracker Barrel that I couldn't wait to try it. I was staying at the Silverton with the kiddo and really the breakfast options aren't great there. I saw Cracker Barrel was in close walking distance so I thought it would be a great idea to head there for a nice breakfast.  You walk in to Cracker Barrel and into a nice country store full of gifts, candies and even Raiders memorabilia. Off to your left is the entrance to the restaurant. We were quickly seated and greeted. We received drinks and made our order. I went with the biscuits, gravy & bacon and the biscuit, hash brown casserole and fried apples plates. The kiddo got the three pancakes plate. The food came out really fast. Very nice. The biscuits and gravy though, were disappointing. Especially coming from a country style restaurant. You get three biscuits and a container of gravy to pour over them. The biscuits were somewhat crunchy on the outside but soft on the inside. The big issue was the gravy. It was pretty bland and I had to add salt to it (!!!). The hash brown casserole was different but I liked it. The fried apples tasted like pie filling to me. But the skin was still on the apples so it definitely wasn't out of a can. The kiddo liked her pancakes. I had a couple of bites and they were decent. Not the fluffiest but the maple syrup they use was very good. Service was awesome. All the servers were very friendly and attentive.  Not sure if it was a case of the hype setting me up for disappointment but I wasn't terribly impressed with Cracker Barrel. The country store was cool and worth checking out, the service was great and the food came out fast. But that same food though. It's not something I'd come back for, especially in a city like Las Vegas where there are so many world class places to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ooh candy!
Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All in on the Raiders when you walk in.

T2jG980B_onnHFuVBubf6Q.text: I like this place so much because they have really great food like the Fried Chicken Tenderloins and the Hashbrown Casserole Kids Meal.  A personal favorite from my mom herself is the Pork Chop Meal and she gives it 3.5 stars And my dad got the Sampler with Ham, Chicken, and Dumplins and he gives it 4.5 stars.    The atmosphere was very quiet nobody was they except for me and my family and a group of three people sitting next to us.   The service was great I like how the lady that served us gave me another side to choose from since all the apple slices were gone and that's why I choose the Hashbrown Casserole so I could get my ranch sauce to eat with my Fried Chicken Tenderloins.     I would like to come back here again, again, and again because they have such a nice waiter and a country store in front of it it's very convenient for people who want to get toys or treats really quickly anyway that is why I want to go back there.

gcBNCA9gDfeWQs_H59SoiQ.text: Love this place. The southern fried chicken was great. Reasonable prices. I have always loved there coffee. Our visit was even more special with our server awesome service. Thank you Mela keep smiling. Mela made sure we were completely happy and satisfied with our food and drinks. Thank you again for the awesome attention.

ozJSWM12zJUqcaM0lqv9mA.text: OMG the food was amazing. Those biscuits were the best. They also have a cute shop when you exit to pay the tab. Service and food were great.

blnQ85PU_75fkS3h0vVO2w.text: My mother in law has been raving about CB forever and had to try it.  We came for breakfast on a Sunday morning.   Check in is at the front outside and it looks like a porch with rocking chairs that are for sale.  It was busy and wait was 30 mins but we got in about 20 mins.  You walk through the country store before the dining room so it was packed.  The dining room is cutely decorated.  Tables are neatly placed but very close to one another.  You can reach over and touch the person next to you.    Service is on point and we never had to wait very long for anything.  We got our food within 10-12 mins.  I ordered the country boy breakfast with steak that included a sample of everything.  Hubs ordered french toast.  Very tasty well seasoned steak although a bit tough but for $12 didn't expect high grade. BEST hash browns that have cheese mixed in. Good grits and apples.  French toast was also the best.  You can taste how much egg is inside.  You pay for your meal in the store and you can add your purchases to it.  The store is surprisingly very reasonably priced.  We spent about $50 in there.    We enjoyed it here so much that we came for lunch the next day.  Lunch was not as good.  The corn bread was so dry and hard it was not edible.  My chicken strips were on par with Denny's so it tasted like frozen.    I still give it 5 stars because there is so much I Love about CB.  I would not hesitate to go again.  They different than anything in its class (breakfast places) that I enjoy the nuances.

YfYGh9gq1ntk9BqxstDNOw.text: I am such a huge fan of Crackel Barrel moving here from Texas. I love the atmosphere, the kind servers/hosts, the food and the little gift shop. This restaurant has such a family friendly environment even after our meals we are stuck playing the game on the table or chess and checkers on the rocking chairs outside. Love love love!

pIMTOwirr8cbZ0dVZ2rUhQ.text: I always enjoy stopping here to eat food is fantastic. The service is grand a big thanks to our server TY you where fast  efficient and tended to all the needs of the table! Also JAY for the awesome seating by the window and for the awesome customer service great attention to detail great attitude and wonder smile! Look forward to coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cracker Barrel Old Country Store - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry Pancakes with Maine Blueberry syrup, Country Fried Steak

50Uqg9AtgZ_vzwGa0t9l9Q.text: Cracker Barrel is about as 2 stars as it gets. They don't do anything bad, but they really don't do anything good either. They're kind of like the middle brother of restaurants. It's just...there.   So I've eaten at Cracker Barrel on two different occasions many, many years apart. I vaguely remembered the first time around that I thought they had really good syrup. Why syrup would stand out and not the meal? Not sure. Well, fast forward like 7-8 years, and I think they still have good syrup, and my entree was highly forgettable. For my entree I went with pancakes, eggs, and bacon. Kind of a staple breakfast for a place that caters to breakfast connisieurs. The pancakes were overcooked, and not just a little overcooked, like dark brown. The bacon was good, crispy just like I ordered it. The eggs, which I ordered over medium, were clearly cooked on way too hot of a griddle and closer to over easy. Pancakes had a decent flavor had they been cooked better.  My wife ordered the chicken fried steak dinner. Another blah-zay option. Gravy didn't have a ton of flavor. The meat did taste a little funny. Again, as a place that is comfort food city, you expect these meals to be decent, and they weren't.  The service also left something to be desired as well. We went on a Friday night, so we expected it to be busy. However, when the third waiter came over to help us, after placing our drink order two prior times it got a little frustrating. We also were dining with our 18 month old and always place his order with our drink order. We asked if we could get some of the biscuits they offer so that the little guy could get his eat on sooner than later. After 15 minutes, asking 4 separate people, we finally got the biscuits, followed by his meal about 30 seconds later. Our meals took another 15 minutes to come out. By the time we got our food a good 40 minutes had passed, we had an antsy toddler, and we were done. When the food comes out and it's less than desirable, it becomes Jason's Series of Unfortunate Events.  PS - the biscuits we eventually got were the most tasteless things I've ever tried in my entire life. Pillsbury canned biscuits are like 11x better.  Slow service, mediocre food at best, and wait times that make zero sense for what they offer. Likely going to pass in the future, which is too bad, because I want this place to be good.

EqUyW5fvcmEBleTpTjni7A.text: I have experienced better for sure. The food was cold the biscuits were hard, the hashbrown casserole was hard and cold, the meat was dry. It seemed like they put it in the microwave to warm it up to send it to us. The only thing that was good was the apples. The service was ok. As Cracker Barrels go, I appreciate the ones in the South much better. Automation

x0H1UI69Ad7zLyAr3uta9Q.text: Everything is delicious here and the service was outstanding. I wished we had this Restaurant in San Diego
